Name: Dublin Castle

Locations.Name: Dublin Castle

Storys.ContentText:
Dubh Linn Garden
Pre 1200: Before the Castle
Viking settlement and port on the site with timber fortifications.

Record Tower
1200 – 1600: Fortress
England’s King John orders a stone castle to be built. This tower remains.

St Patrick’s Hall
1600 – 1700: Fortress to Palace
Dublin Castle is a prison, barracks and official government  residence. Destroyed by fire in 1684 and rebuilt.

Upper Courtyard 
1700 – 1800: Georgian  Palace
Elegant Georgian buildings at the heart English power and fashionable Irish society.
Wigs like this were the height of fashion.
Courtyard of the castle Dublin Ireland
Duke and Duchess of York in Dublin - 1897
Dublin Castle
Dublin Alphonse Dousseau
Industries of Dublin 1887
J. Tudor - A prospect of the Upper Castle Court from the council chamber Dublin c.1750
Mary rose Barton 1891
Michelangelo Hayes - St Patricks Day Military Parade at Dublin Castle

State Apartments
1800 – 1900: Show & ceremony
Dublin Castle is the ceremonial centre of Ireland, hosting kings, queens and grand events.

Law Courts
1800 – 1900:  Power & Control

The Castle is barracks for the British army and police headquarters. 
Marches and  parades show imperial power.

Bedford Tower
20th century:  Revolution & Change

Dublin Castle is a symbolic target for resistance. 
The  Viceroy’s official decorations are stolen in a daring raid of the Bedford Tower.

Palace Street Gate
1922: Liberation
Michael Collins arrives at Dublin Castle for the handover of power from Britain to the new Free State of Ireland.

Castle Connections
Heart of Ireland

Dublin Castle lies at the heart of Irish history.  
Its  story connects with sites across the city and the nation.

Locations.AboutText: Erected in the early thirteenth century on the site of a Viking settlement, Dublin Castle served for centuries as the headquarters of English, and later British, administration in Ireland. In 1922, following Ireland’s independence, Dublin Castle was handed over to the new Irish government. It is now a major government complex and a key tourist attraction. We hope you enjoy your visit.
